moves.10. Bxb5+: Taking with check. Black is unable to respond in the same way.
moves.10... Bd7 11. Bxd7+ Nxd7 12. b5: I am up a pawn, but Black has initiative
moves.12... Bb4+ 13. Bd2 Bxd2+ 14. Nxd2 gxf4: bringing flank pawn closer to center
moves.15. gxf5: doing the same. Now the g-file is wide open. Both sides have potential outposts Kt-KN5
moves.16. Rc1: eyeing the c6-square to exploit control of the queenside in Black's territory
moves.17. Rc6: only if I get to boost the value of b-pawn, then I am good with trade
moves.18... Rxc6 19. bxc6: I bring flank pawn closer to center, improving its value
moves.21. Qb7: but my queen goes to aggressive square.
moves.24... Qxa5 25. Nxa5: now it is a rook knight endgame
moves.26. Ng5: but I fork Black's rook and knight
moves.26... Nxg5: so Black is forced to give me an additional passed pawn
moves.28. d6: 2 connected passed pawns on the 6th rank will beat a rook
moves.28... Nxf5: Black is hoping for c7 but I push the other one instead
moves.29. d7: Black resigned, in view of Rf8 c7 followed by d8
